alert.note: Alert for Clark; Nye (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 08 at 7:27PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by moderate rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of California and Nevada, including the following counties, in California, Inyo and San Bernardino. In Nevada, Clark and Nye. * WHEN...Until 900 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 725 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate rain associated with isolated thunderstorms beginning to exit southern Nye County. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pahrump, Shoshone, Furnace Creek, Death Valley Junction, Tecopa, Amargosa Valley, Lathrop Wells, and Sandy Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
